"Rat Bait"
"Has Anybody Seen My Head?"
"Dirge For a Deadly Duet"
"Our Subject For Tonight Is "Fear" "¬†
¬†
Note: ¬†In 1978 the series was abruptly canceled in a company wide decision on cancellations which has become known as the¬†DC Implosion . ¬†This series was merged with¬†The Unexpected .¬†
name: Our Subject For Tonight Is "Fear"

description: It's a big problem when ALF's spaceship gets accidently picked up by the garbage men in "At Your Disposal." Then ALF goes along on the family's ski resort vacation but struggles with having to stay indoors and out of sight, especially when Brian is having bully problems in "Snow Skin Off My Nose." And in "Play Misty for Me," ALF tells Willie and Kate about his "glory days" as an orbit guard on Melmac.

ALF's anti-gravity belt causes problems for Brian at school in "All's Fair." Then ALF tells Willie and Kate about the time he went undercover on Melmac in "All My Life's a Cycle." And in "Jungle Love," the Tanner Family takes a trip to the Jungle Trails Park and ALF goes along in disguise.
name: Hey, A Customer!

description: What if the situation had been reversed? What with Willie had landed on ALF's planet and not vice versa? ALF shows that possibility to Willie in "Travels with Willie." Then it's the anniversary of ALF landing on Earth but the special cake the Tanners made for the event causes problems for their neighbor in "One Tiny Mistake."
name: Alien Life Form

description: ALF does a personality switch with Kate in "It's All in Your Minds." Then ALF tells the family about the time that he had to deal with a monster while he was part of the Melmac orbit guard in "Monster Mash." And in "One Herd to Go," ALF is stuck at home alone while the Tanners go out for the evening and ends up getting snatched by a coat burglar.
name: The Fantastic Fur To The Rescue!

description: Willie's former school, California Central, needs a new mascot for their sports events. And ALF is happy to volunteer in "Be of Good Cheer." Then ALF tells Willie and Kate about the terrible things that happened when his family on Melmac won a lottery in "That's the Ticket." And in "Hair Today, Gone Tomorrow," ALF and the Tanners have to deal with ALF going through the Melmac shed cycle.
name: The Sexiest Face On Earth!

description: ALF helps out when Lynn gets a part in her school play in "Going Through a Stage." Then ALF tells Kate about Melmac's great botanical philosopher in "Aloe Again, Naturally." And in "Bounce Thy Neighbor," trouble starts when Trevor, the next door neighbor tries to fix a crucial part of ALF's spaceship.
name: Gesundheit!

description: After seeing how many holidays the Tanners have, ALF gets to celebrate a Melmacian holiday in "The Holiday the Earth Stood Still." Then ALF tells Lynn about his ancestor who played a key role in the Melmac Revolution in "The Melvolutionary War." And in "A Tree-Mendous Mistake," ALF celebrates the Melmac Wear-A-Plant-Day but the tree he planted for the event causes problems.
name: All Holiday Issue!

description: ALF wants to go to school and arranges a way where he can do that without leaving the house in "Back to School Daze." Then ALF tells Lynn about his senior class dance at the Orbit Guard Academy in "May I Have This Dance?" And in "Small Worlds," ALF gets a taste of the great outdoors while Willie tries to fix the car which broke down along a country road.

ALF goes trick-or-treating with Brian and of course ends up causing all sorts of problems in "Ghosts, Goblins and Gordon." Then the Tanners discover that ALF has a pet bird in "I Did It Mynah Way." Issue also has a double-page centerpiece "Alf for President" Campaign Kit.
name: [Ghosts, Goblins, & Gordon! (Shumway That Is!)]

description: ALF hits his head and doesn't know who he is nor does he recognize the Tanners in "No Thanks for the Memories." Then ALF tells Willie about his famous ancestor from Melmac's pioneer days in "A Town Without Kittys." And in "Hair We Grow Again," ALF helps Lynn with her hair and that results in a problem.
name: ["ALF! I Wanted My Hair Conditioner! Not Yours!"]

description: An obnoxious race car driver challenges anyone to beat his car on the track. So ALF decides to take up that challenge in "Race Tracks of My Tears." Then ALF activates his personal Melbot which causes all sorts of trouble in "Role of the Dice." Issue also has a double-page centerpiece Alf Christmas Card.
name: [I Got A Bum "Wrap"! Ha!]

description: A whale is beached at the Valencia Beach near the Tanners, so ALF decides to do something about it in "It's Good for What Whales You." Then ALF tells about some scary shows that his home planet Melmac had in "Night of the Living Bread." And in "Sometimes the Tooth Hurts," ALF has a toothache and the Tanners try to help.
name: [Night Of The Living Bread!]

description:
Alf runs away, after overhearing a conversation that he thinks is about him, but is actually about a character on Dallas. Alf meets a hobo named Squinty McGinty. The two start riding the rails.

Meanwhile the Tanners have discovered Alf's goodbye note and Brian is heartbroken. In Las Vegas, Alf has won big by shooting dice. Celebrating with a feast, he regales Squinty with the tale of William Shumspeare, an ancestor of his. Squinty sleeps through the tale. Alf decides to stop running and return to the Tanners in style. He tries to double his money, but loses it all playing Bingo. Alf strikes out on the road, leaving Squinty in Las Vegas.

He decides to join a sideshow, and is billed as the Missing Link. However his first paycheck is extremely low, due to the owners deductions. He also finds out that instead of going to Los Angeles (LA) they are instead heading to Los Armadillo, Mexico. He tries to quit, but he has signed a contract. He responds by eating the contract out of the owners hands, getting him fired.

In a lucky break, a meat delivery has just arrived and he decides to mail himself back COD in a crate. Alf's arrival is great news and they sign with such enthusiasm that the delivery man thinks them cannibals.
name: The Run Run Run Run Runaway!

description: The coat burglar (from issue #4) escapes from prison and is up to his old tricks. So ALF needs to become a super hero and stop the villain in "The Return of the Fantastic Fur." Then ALF tells Willie about his days on Melmac as a spy in "The Spy Who Came in from the Mold." And in "Surrender Dorothy," Kate's mother has to take care of ALF and put up with his antics.
name: Return Of The Fantastic Fur!

description: What would it be like for the Tanners and ALF 30 years in the future? ALF shows that with his Wotif Simulator in "Melmac to the Future." Then ALF takes up painting and his work gets the interest of the L.A. Art Club and others in "So Long, Old Paint." And in "Academy Reward," ALF tells Brian about basic training at Orbit Guard Academy.
name: [Melmac To The Future!]

description: When ALF gets a "snootful" of chemicals, pollen and bugs, it causes him to grow and grow and grow. And that makes it even more difficult to keep ALF's existence a secret in "Melmacattack of the 50 Foot ALF." Then ALF and Willie try to move ALF's stuff in "A Moving Experience." And in "Back Off," while Kate and the kids are out of town, Willie injures himself and has ALF as a caregiver.
name: [ALF, This Is The Last Time You Pack Lunch For Me!]

description: Swimsuits become a source for trouble and antics for both the Tanners and ALF in "The Swimsuit Issue." Then the Tanners get some great results with things when ALF starts using his Predict-A-Phone in "The Alfstrologer." And in "Citizen Sugar Kane," ALF tells Lynn about his days back on Melmac when he was a reporter.
name: [The Swimsuit Issue!]

description: ALF tries out some new looks with disastrous results in "Vanity, Thy Name is ALF." Then ALF tells Willie and Kate about his barbarian ancestor on Melmac in "Gornan the Bar-B-Q-Barian," an ALF version of Robert E. Howard's Conan the Barbarian. And in "Babe In the Woods ‚Äì Part 1," ALF's babysitting duties don't go so well and as a result, he leaves the Tanners.

On his own in the woods after leaving the Tanners, ALF helps take care of a family of beavers in "Babe In the Woods ‚Äì Part 2." Then ALF tells Lynn about the time on Melmac when he had to guard a V.I.D. ‚Äì Very Important Diva in "A Night at the I-Hopera." And in "I'd Like to Buy a Vowel," ALF loses the ability to speak vowels and has trouble communicating with the Tanners.
name: ["That was your famous bouillabaseball dipsey-doodle corkscrew curveball, ALF?"]

description:
Alf's Melmacian bird calls shatter a window in Willie's garage, leading to Alf showing his Meleporter, the Quasar Queen, a talking computer with the capability of sending its user anywhere it wants. However it is rather unfriendly. While demonstrating it, it sends Alf somewhere in Australia.Lynn succeeds in cracking the system after two days, but it sends her to the same place it sent Alf. Alf passes the time with a Melmac Flashback, the tale of Shumlock Holmes. Shortly after the tale ends, they are transported to a snowy arctic wasteland.

Kate's emotional appeal to the Quasar Queen and it's learning that Alf is not on Melmac anymore leads to their return and an emotional reunion.
name: Around The World In 80 Hours!

description: Special 25th anniversary issue in which the coat burglar (from issues #4 and 16) returns and is seeking revenge against ALF. How does the coat burglar get his revenge? He kidnaps ALF and holds him for ransom and the Tanners try to figure out a way to rescue their furry alien friend in "The Silver Annimercenary." Issue also has an ALF 25th Anniversary pinup.
name: The Silver Annimercenary!

description: Brian runs for student council president and ALF decides to help as his campaign manager in "Campaign in the Neck." Then ALF talks about his legendary ancestor, King Alfur and the glorious days of Hamelot in "For One Brief Shining Melmoment." And in "Take This Job and Love It," ALF gets a job of selling trees but causes problems when he adds some Melmiracle Gro to the trees.
name: Radishes always make me repeat! Ha!

description:
Brian launches the ejection seat from Alf's ship with Alf in it. Alf lands somewhere in the Pacific Ocean. Instead of flares, he finds Plair pens. Alf catches a fish and uses the skeleton as a paddle. He spots a tropical island and heads toward it, only to be caught by a sub that surfaces under him. He clings to the periscope as it reveals that the island is actually a secret base, belonging to the Alien Task Force. He hides in a line of models of supposed aliens, one of which resembles ET. He steals a sup, accidentally torpedoing a ship. The rest give chase, but he dives an loses them. He calls Willie on his ham radio and arranges a meeting at a deserted marina.

Alf recounts the tale of the Honeyspooners.

Alf helps Brian learn to play the trumpet
name: Ejection Slip!

description: ALF hits his head and then has temporary hallucinations in which he imagines that the Tanners are his Melmac family in "Family Tie-Dyes." Then while out on an all-boys camping trip, ALF, Willie and Brian have to deal with Bigfoot problems in "Bigfoot in the Mouth."
name: ["Please let me stay!"]

description: When Brian works on the school newspaper, ALF gives him some lessons on investigative reporting in "Used Karma." Then ALF explains to Brian what horrible places theme parks are by telling him all about the Melmac version of theme parks in "Pop Goes the Quiz." And in "The Melmatchmaker," ALF fears for the worst when Kate and Willie have an argument and tries to resolve their differences. Issue has a Statement of Ownership, Management and Circulation which states that the average monthly total paid circulation for the preceding 12 months was 108,600 issues.
name: 3-D Cover!

description: Alf sets out to speed baby Eric's growth -- with hilarious results!
name: Big Words = Big Trouble in "Speaker of the House"

description: Little Eric gets upset because he is too young to go to summer camp. So ALF brings the summer camp to him in "Shummer Camp." Then ALF explains why Melmacians and cats are enemies in "Pyramid-Life Crisis." And in "Safari About That," when a lion escapes from a circus train, ALF decides to capture it.
name: The Game Of ALF

description: ALF's new exercise and diet programs to get himself in better shape has surprising results but also comes with problems for the Tanners in "Muscle Bound for Glory." Then ALF shows the action figure for Melmacho Man, the most merchandised hero on Melmac. But the action figure is definitely built for action in "Go Figure." And in "Imagine That," ALF's imaginary friend drives the Tanners crazy.
name: Muscle Bound For Glory

description: ALF and the Tanners spend an evening playing Luncheons and Flagons, the Melmacian hard-roll-playing game in "Man Over Game Board." Then ALF finds out that a TV show has a $5,000 prize for the most unusual video. So he sends in a video of himself and the Tanners have to scramble to keep people from finding out about ALF in "Home Vide-Uh-Oh." Issue also has an ALF's Dress Up Dali page.
name: Wanted ALF

description: Brian accidentally breaks open one of ALF's fear cans and it causes the Tanners and the neighbors to fear that their houses won't pass a surprise inspection in "The Only Thing We Have to Fear is ALF Himself." Then ALF tells Kate and Brian about the time Melmac had a bread shortage in "Judge for Yourself," an ALF version of Judge Dredd. Issue also has an ALF version of famous comic strips in "The Phunny Pages."
name: Melmac Rap!

description:
Willie and ALF take care of Willie's friend's farm.

ALF tells Kate and Brian about the time he traded his brother for a box of rusty pop-tops.

Blueprints for the perfect Melmacian kitchen.
name: I may not know art, but I know what I like! Urp!

description:
ALF finds himself hunted by beings that look like trees.

ALF tells Brian about his encounter with Dr. Whozonfirst. Bed Slime Stories; ALF reads Melmacian fairy tales to Kate and Eric.
name: [The New ALF Mutant From Melmac]

description: ALF panics when the Tanners' TV stops working. And when he tries to fix the TV, he ends up inside it in "T.V. F.X. N.X.S." Then ALF tells Brian about his days on the Orbit Guard Patrol and when he met Doc Cabbage in "Classical Gastritis," an ALF version of a Doc Savage adventure.
name: Do Not Attempt To Adjust Your Set!

description: Skip lands on Earth to alert ALF to a problem on New Melmac. So ALF journeys to New Melmac to help while Skip stays with the Tanners in "Send in the Clones," an adventure in three parts, "Skip to the Chase," "Don't Get a Rhonda Much Anymore" and "The Epi-Cheese Log." Then in "ALF's Sci-Fry Marathon," ALF presents some ALF versions of famous and classic sci fi TV shows.
name: Which Is The Real ALF?

description:
When ALF and the Tanners return home to find one of their windows broken, ALF sets up a bunch of boobytraps to stop burglars.

ALF gives a history of Melmac's favorite sci-fi show: Star Shlep.

ALF tells Willie and Lynn about Melmac's most famous musicals.
name: [Amazing Hologram Cover!]

description: It's the adventure of a lifetime for ALF when the X-Melmen (an ALF version of Marvel's X-Men) come back into his life and he helps them out in "ALF's Xcellent Adventure," an adventure in five parts, "Xposition Through Xtrapolation," "An Xtemporaneous Xit," "Xterminate with Xtreme Prejudice," "Xacting Revenge" and "Xuberant Xhilarated Xstacy."
name: [Welcome To The X-Melmen, Nightcaller. . .]

description:
When ALF consumes a cup of "Gravi-Tea" he sinks through the ground and stumbles upon a race of underground-dwelling humanoids.

ALF tells the Tanners about the Griddle League of Bouillabaseball on Melmac.
name: TV Sitcoms And Comic Books Are Fine, But What I Really Want To Do Is Direct. . .

description: The countdown begins for the final issue of ALF with Part 1 of "Th ‚Äì Th ‚Äì Th That's ALF Folks -- Meteor 'Bye Products" in which ALF discovers that the mineral that will power his ship home is in the famous meteor crater near Flagstaff, Arizona. So all he has to do is go to Flagstaff and get some of that mineral. Easier said than done! Then ALF tells Lynn about his famous ancestor Robbin' Food, an ALF version of Robin Hood in "Footprints of Thieves."
name: ALF Today

description:
Mr Bittner finds out that ALF is living at the Tanner's house and tries to bring him in for study.

ALF tells Willie about his uncle, the Melmacian actor named Shumphrey Bogart.
name: [All New 100% Fresh]

description: The countdown continues for the final issue of ALF with Part 3 of "Th ‚Äì Th ‚Äì Th That's ALF, Folks ‚Äì A Melmodest Proposal" in which ALF tries to pop the question, make arrangements for a wedding, stay ahead of the agent from the alien task force that is pursuing him and plan for his trip home. Then Rhonda goes it alone in her first (and last) solo story and tries to deal with the Planet of the Shapes in "Getting Into Shapes."
name: [Penultimate Issue!]

description: The countdown concludes for the final issue of ALF with Part 4 of "Th ‚Äì Th ‚Äì Th That's ALF, Folks ‚Äì ALF Weidersehn" in which a Melmac wedding takes place and then the alien task force closes in on ALF. Or do they? Find out what happens to ALF and the Tanners in this double-size series-ending issue. Then ALF convinces the editors at Marvel Comics to do a biographical data profile page on him for the Marvel universe in "Universal Acceptance." And in "And Now, Ladies and Gentlemen‚Ä¶One Last Time‚Ä¶Heeeeeeeeeeere's ALF," our favorite furry alien shows the past and future with the Tanners in a talk-show style setting. Issue also has a double-page special final issue pinup.
name: Cancelled!
